testcase.name: runScenario["Verify Admin can successfully create a new Main Category", "Admin Category Management API"](1)
testcase.system-out: @api @admin @tc_admin_create_01 Scenario: Verify Admin can successfully create a new Main Category # src/test/resources/features/api/AdminCategoryApi.feature:4 Given the API server is up and running # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.api_server_is_up() And the user is authenticated as "admin" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.user_is_authenticated(java.lang.String) When the user sends a POST request to "/api/categories" with name "Catcus" and no parent # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.user_sends_post_category_main(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Response Body: {"id":211,"name":"Catcus","subCategories":[]} Then the API response status code should be 201 # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_status_code(int) And the response body should contain the field "name" with string value "Catcus" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_body_field_string_value(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) And the response body should contain the field "id" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_body_has_field(java.lang.String) And the response body should contain the field "subCategories" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_body_has_field(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: runScenario["Verify validation for Category Name Length (Min 3 chars)", "Admin Category Management API"](3)
testcase.system-out: @api @admin @tc_admin_create_03 Scenario: Verify validation for Category Name Length (Min 3 chars) # src/test/resources/features/api/AdminCategoryApi.feature:28 Given the API server is up and running # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.api_server_is_up() And the user is authenticated as "admin" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.user_is_authenticated(java.lang.String) When the user sends a POST request to "/api/categories" with name "AB" and no parent # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.user_sends_post_category_main(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Response Body: {"details":{"name":"Category name must be between 3 and 10 characters"},"error":"BAD_REQUEST","message":"Validation failed","status":400,"timestamp":"2026-02-07T22:20:59.1043071"} Then the API response status code should be 400 # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_status_code(int) And the response body should contain the field "error" with string value "BAD_REQUEST" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_body_field_string_value(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) And the response body should contain the field "message" with string value "Validation failed" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_body_field_string_value(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

testcase.name: runScenario["Verify Unique Name Constraint (Prevent Duplicate Categories)", "Admin Category Management API"](4)
testcase.system-out: @api @admin @tc_admin_create_04 Scenario: Verify Unique Name Constraint (Prevent Duplicate Categories) # src/test/resources/features/api/AdminCategoryApi.feature:40 Given the API server is up and running # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.api_server_is_up() And the user is authenticated as "admin" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.user_is_authenticated(java.lang.String) When the user sends a POST request to "/api/categories" with name "Catcus" and no parent # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.user_sends_post_category_main(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Response Body: {"status":400,"error":"DUPLICATE_RESOURCE","message":"Main category 'Catcus' already exists","timestamp":"2026-02-07T22:20:59.4478772"} Then the API response status code should be 400 # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_status_code(int) And the response body should contain the field "error" with string value "DUPLICATE_RESOURCE" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_body_field_string_value(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) And the response body should contain the field "message" with string value "Main category 'Catcus' already exists" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_body_field_string_value(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

testcase.name: runScenario["Verify Role-Based Access Control (User Restriction)", "Admin Category Management API"](5)
testcase.system-out: @api @admin @tc_admin_create_05 Scenario: Verify Role-Based Access Control (User Restriction) # src/test/resources/features/api/AdminCategoryApi.feature:54 Given the API server is up and running # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.api_server_is_up() And the user is authenticated as "user" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.user_is_authenticated(java.lang.String) When the user sends a POST request to "/api/categories" with name "NewCat" and no parent # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.user_sends_post_category_main(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Response Body: {"timestamp":"2026-02-07T16:50:59.837+00:00","status":403,"error":"Forbidden","path":"/api/categories"} Then the API response status code should be 403 # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_status_code(int) And the response body should contain the field "error" with string value "Forbidden" # com.example.api.stepDefinitions.CategoryApiStepDefinitions.verify_body_field_string_value(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
